The garden setting is not merely decorative but integral to the experience, transforming dining into a meditative ritual.

sections.title: Menu & Signature Experience
sections.body: The menu focuses on a fresh fusion of healthy cuisine and local ingredients. Each dish is carefully crafted to nourish both body and palate. Signature experiences include their artisanal breakfast bowls, fresh-pressed juices, and carefully brewed coffee. The dining experience is designed to be slow and intentional, encouraging guests to savor each bite while enjoying the tranquil surroundings.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.body: Jiwa Garden & Cafe represents the new wave of wellness dining in Bali. It successfully creates a space that combines nutritious food with spiritual nourishment. This holistic approach makes it a preferred destination for modern travelers seeking not just a meal, but a transformative experience.

sections.title: Concept & Ambiance
sections.body: Nüde operates on a brand philosophy of "balance," believing that "healthy... doesn't need to be tasteless," perfectly captured by their tagline, "Sometimes Naughty, Always Nice." It aims to be an "original hangout" in Canggu, a "home away from home" for its guests. The ambiance is warm and welcoming, with a separate air-conditioned space perfect for laptop work, balancing social and productive needs.

sections.title: Menu & Signature Experience
sections.body: The menu is designed to be one of the "most inclusive cafes in Canggu," offering full vegetarian and vegan menus. Must-try dishes include the Truffled Scrambled Eggs and the Rosti Stack. However, what truly stands out in reviews is the exceptional service. The staff is described as "the best I have experienced," with a friendliness and attentiveness that makes every guest feel like an old friend.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.body: Nüde's success lies in its mastery of hospitality. Its philosophy of balance is reflected in its inclusive menu and its ability to be both a relaxed hangout and a productive workspace. It has cultivated a loyal following by delivering an "exceptional service experience" that makes every guest feel welcome.

sections.title: Concept & Ambience
sections.body: Secret Spot is a "popular 'hipster surf style cafe'" and a "hidden gem" whose concept is built around a fully "plant-based, gluten-free menu". It aims to be a "cozy and charming atmosphere, perfect for unwinding or working". The ambience is a "laid-back vibe" with a "beautiful, minimalistic design" and a "chilled island vibe". It's a comfortable space with "ample comfy seats, good ac, [and] plugs," making it a favorite for remote work.

sections.title: Menu & Signature Experience
sections.body: The menu is entirely vegan, and it excels at making plant-based food that is creative and delicious. One reviewer was "genuinely surprised that vegan food could taste this good!". The signature experience is indulging in their surprisingly hearty and flavorful dishes. The "Italian sourdough sandwiches are spectacular," and the "vegan pizzas (the spicy pumpkin is soooo moreish...)" receive high praise. Other standout dishes include "The tofu scramble," which is a highlight, as well as pumpkin ravioli and falafel bliss bowls.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.body: Secret Spot successfully demystifies vegan dining by offering a menu of spectacular plant-based comfort food in a "chilled island vibe" setting. It has become a go-to destination for both dedicated vegans and the curious, proving that a menu free from animal products can be incredibly satisfying, flavorful, and "soooo moreish."

sections.title: Guiding Philosophy
sections.body: B Work's core mission is to help its members find their "ideal work-life balance" in Bali. It's about more than just providing a desk; it's dedicated to creating an environment where members can "spend their time meaningfully." This philosophy extends to fostering "a community of like-minded people creating meaningful value," indicating a focus on purpose-driven professionals. Reviews confirm this, describing it as a place where one can "work and chill."

sections.title: Signature Experience & Unique Features
sections.body:
Wellness and Lifestyle Integration: This is a key differentiator for B Work. They offer dedicated programs like a rooftop yoga school, surf lessons, craft experiences, and curated day trips. This positions it as an all-encompassing lifestyle hub, not just a workspace. One reviewer specifically highlighted the pool and yoga shala as major draws.

Community Program: The "G.O. (Global Organizer) Program" is a unique "talent-sharing" concept that formalizes and systematizes the kind of skill-sharing that often happens spontaneously in other spaces.

Layout & Facilities: The space is described as "gorgeous, spacious, and quiet," featuring multiple zones including a pool garden, a rooftop garden, and a café that is open to the public. It offers 24/7 access for its members.

sections.title: Environment: Layout, Capacity & Vibe
sections.body:
Layout: A multi-zone environment designed to suit "every mood and work style." It includes a public café, a members-only "sun-drenched workspace" on the second floor, focus rooms, meeting rooms, and extensive outdoor areas. Reviews explicitly praise the layout for having both quiet focus rooms and a social café. Its surf camp, which features bungalows for up to 8 people, indicates coliving capabilities.

Capacity: While a total number is not given, the description of a large space with multiple zones and a surf camp suggests a significant capacity.

Vibe & Bustle: The atmosphere is a blend of productivity and relaxation. One reviewer called it their "favorite coworking space in Canggu." The café can be busy and serves as a social hub, while the dedicated work areas remain quiet and focused. It can get crowded due to its popularity, but the spacious layout seems to handle the foot traffic well. A Reddit comment praised its community and noted that a well-known community manager works there.

sections.title: Community: Networking & Events
sections.body: Events are a core part of the B Work experience. They host a weekly schedule of activities, some open to the public and others exclusive to members, including yoga, salsa, pilates, and surfing. This active event calendar makes it "the perfect place to make friends."

sections.title: Pricing & Access Guide
sections.body:
Pricing is multi-tiered to suit different needs.

Day Pass: IDR 280,000 (IDR 199,000 for local ID holders).

Weekend Pass: IDR 390,000.

Hourly/Flex Packages: 30 hours (from IDR 750k), 50 hours (IDR 1.55M), 100 hours (IDR 2.65M). Hours are tracked automatically by connecting to the WiFi.

Unlimited Monthly Pass: IDR 3,850,000/month.

Off-Peak Packages: Weekly (IDR 800k) and monthly (IDR 2.4M) options are available.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.body: B Work is a quintessential "work-life" hub. It's ideal for professionals who want to seamlessly blend productive work with the wellness and adventure lifestyle of Bali. Its premium price point is justified by its extensive, high-quality facilities and built-in social calendar. It's less for nomads on a tight budget and more for established professionals seeking a high-end, all-in-one experience.

sections.title: Guiding Philosophy
sections.body: Ducat's philosophy appears to revolve around providing a "professional and inspiring space" that is modern, clean, and functional. Its emphasis on "minimalist chic" and natural light suggests a focus on creating a calm, aesthetically pleasing, and uncluttered work environment.

sections.title: Signature Experience & Unique Features
sections.body:
Team-Oriented: Ducat's most prominent feature is its focus on private offices for teams. They explicitly offer spaces that can accommodate teams of 4, 6, 8, or 15 people. This, combined with the affordable pricing for these offices, makes it a premier solution for startups and small teams operating in Bali.

Vertical Layout: It is a multi-story building with a clear vertical separation of functions: a cozy café on the ground floor, with the upper two floors dedicated to coworking and meeting rooms. This design naturally separates the social buzz of the café from the focused work areas.

sections.title: Environment: Layout, Capacity & Vibe
sections.body:
Layout: A modern, attractive, and brand-new space with huge floor-to-ceiling windows offering "great views of Canggu." The space is described as bright, air-conditioned, and not crowded.

Capacity: While the capacity for hot desks isn't specified, its ability to house private offices for teams of up to 15 indicates a respectable overall capacity.

Vibe & Bustle: The atmosphere is professional and focused. "Not crowded" is a key selling point mentioned in reviews. Its minimalist design likely contributes to a calm and productive vibe, contrasting with the more "tropical" or "bohemian" styles of other spaces.

sections.title: Community: Networking & Events
sections.body: Available information describes Ducat as a space for "meetings or team collaborations" and mentions it can be booked for events and conferences. However, there is no specific information about a regular schedule of public or community-building events. The focus seems to be more on providing infrastructure for teams rather than curating a social community for individual nomads.

sections.title: Pricing & Access Guide
sections.body:
Pricing is considered quite affordable, especially for teams.

Coworking (Hot Desk): From IDR 1,200,000/month.

Private Office: From IDR 15,000,000/month (for teams of 4, 6, 8, or 15).

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.body: Ducat Space is the pragmatic choice for small businesses, startups, and established teams that need a professional, clean, and affordable base of operations in Canggu. Its value proposition is less about the social experience for solo nomads and more about providing high-quality, functional office infrastructure. Its minimalist aesthetic and quieter atmosphere will also appeal to those who prioritize focus over socializing.

sections.title: Guiding Philosophy
sections.body: Genesis's reason for being is to be a home for creatives. Its philosophy is embodied in its name: a place where "any idea, big or small... has a place to start." Its mission is to make the "creative journey affordable, accessible, and fun" by providing not just space, but also professional tools and a collaborative community. Their mantra is "Create, Collaborate, Showcase."

sections.title: Signature Experience & Unique Features
sections.body:
Professional Creative Studios: This is the undeniable core of Genesis. They have fully-equipped, professional-grade studios for video production, photography, podcasting, music production, and DJing. This is a unique and powerful offering that goes far beyond what any other coworking space provides. They also house an art studio and a fashion studio.

Production Services: Beyond renting space, they offer in-house production services for videos, online courses, and monthly brand content. This makes it a one-stop shop for content creators.

sections.title: Environment: Layout, Capacity & Vibe
sections.body:
Layout: Located within the Tamora Gallery lifestyle complex, Genesis is a hub of specialized creative studios alongside a traditional coworking space with office furniture. One review praised its "warm and supportive atmosphere."

Capacity: Capacity is distributed among its various studios and the central coworking area. While no total number is given, the emphasis is on the quality and specialization of the spaces rather than on a massive scale of hot desks.

Vibe & Bustle: The atmosphere is distinctly creative, collaborative, and supportive. One review explicitly contrasts it with spaces "filled with soulless dropshippers," highlighting its focus on "meaningful work." This is a place for making things, not just typing on a laptop. The vibe is described as revolutionary for the Bali arts industry.

sections.title: Community: Networking & Events
sections.body: Genesis actively cultivates a creative community through public events and workshops. The "weCREATE" event is a prime example: a one-day creative festival with workshops in art, fashion, music, and video production, alongside talks from prominent figures. These events are explicitly "open to the public," making Genesis a true community hub. They also support initiatives like Fashion Revolution Week.

sections.title: Pricing & Access Guide
sections.body:
The pricing structure is designed to provide access to both the general coworking area and the specialized studios.

Coworking Day Pass: IDR 100,000.

Coworking Monthly Membership: IDR 1,500,000 (includes discounts and free hours in the studios).

Studio Rental: Billed hourly, with discounts for long-term rentals. A ticket for a "weCREATE" workshop was Rp. 400,000, indicating pricing for specific public events.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.body: Genesis is unparalleled for any professional involved in creative production. Podcasters, YouTubers, photographers, musicians, designers, and artists will find its facilities and community invaluable. It's not just a place to work, but a place to produce. Its relatively low cost for general coworking makes it an accessible entry point, with the professional studios available as a powerful resource on demand. For the hands-on creator, this is the definitive choice.

sections.title: Guiding Philosophy
sections.body: Karya positions itself as a "high-end" and "boutique" coworking space. Its philosophy is to provide an inspiring and productive environment for the "traveling professional." A key part of its ethos is a genuine interest in Balinese culture and art, aiming to connect members with the "real people" of the island, beyond the "tourist facade."

sections.title: Signature Experience & Unique Features
sections.body:
Comprehensive Business Services: Karya's standout feature is its suite of corporate services. They offer a virtual office address, company incorporation consulting, secretarial services, and accounting services. This makes it the top choice for those looking to formally establish and operate a business in Bali.

Exclusivity and Privacy: The space focuses on private offices and dedicated desks rather than a large, open-plan hot-desking area. This emphasis on secure, private, lockable spaces caters to professionals and businesses that require confidentiality and a stable base. Some offices even come with a Nespresso machine.

sections.title: Environment: Layout, Capacity & Vibe
sections.body:
Layout: A modern, stylish, boutique space in the heart of Berawa. It features private offices (some with rice field views), dedicated desks, meeting rooms, and soundproof phone booths.

Capacity: The focus on private offices and dedicated desks means its total capacity is lower than large open-plan spaces, fostering a more private and professional environment.

Vibe & Bustle: The atmosphere is professional, mature, and network-oriented. It's a community of "like-minded people from around the world" who are serious about their work. It is described as the go-to place for those looking to "run a business from Bali."

sections.title: Community: Networking & Events
sections.body: Karya hosts "exclusive events" for its members, designed to help them develop new skills and learn about local businesses. The community is built around individuals who have a "genuine interest in Balinese culture and arts." This suggests a more curated and culturally engaged community than the typical nomad party scene.

sections.title: Pricing & Access Guide
sections.body:
The pricing reflects its high-end, service-oriented positioning.

Coworking Space (likely dedicated desk): IDR 225,000/day; IDR 3,750,000/month.

Private Office (2-3 people): IDR 10M - 15M/month.

Meeting Room: IDR 500k - 1M/day.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.body: Karya is the premier choice for serious entrepreneurs, business owners, or consultants who need more than just a desk. Its comprehensive business support services are a unique and powerful value proposition. It is perfectly suited for those looking to establish a long-term professional presence in Bali who value privacy, security, and networking with other established professionals.

sections.title: Guiding Philosophy
sections.body: Nebula's core concept is to be a "green co-working space" where "ideas turn into action." They focus on helping entrepreneurs launch and scale their businesses by providing an inspiring workspace, a supportive community, and the essential resources needed for focus and productivity.

sections.title: Signature Experience & Unique Features
sections.body:
Wellness and Recovery Facilities: Nebula's most unique feature is its in-house spa facility, which includes an ice bath, sauna, and showers. This caters directly to the biohacking and wellness-focused entrepreneur, providing tools for mental and physical recovery to enhance productivity.

Content Creation Infrastructure: Similar to Genesis, they offer a fully-equipped recording studio and soundproof phone booths, making it a strong option for podcasters and content creators.

"Jungle Oasis" Aesthetic: The space is renowned for its interior design, filled with lush greenery to create a "jungle office" feel that is both "calm and inspiring." This is a key part of its brand and user experience.

sections.title: Environment: Layout, Capacity & Vibe
sections.body:
Layout: The space skillfully blends modern architecture with nature, featuring "lush greenery and plenty of natural light." It's described as spacious, clean, and quiet, with a large event room and multiple breakout areas.

Capacity: With a 20-person meeting room, private offices, and dedicated desks, the capacity is moderate, but the layout is designed to feel spacious.

Vibe & Bustle: The overwhelming consensus in reviews is that the vibe is "amazing," "quiet," "relaxing," and "serene." It is a place for deep focus, where the "plants really help calm the nervous system." The atmosphere is both productive and tranquil, attracting users who value a calm work environment.

sections.title: Community: Networking & Events
sections.body: Nebula regularly hosts workshops and events that provide "excellent networking opportunities." User reviews confirm attending valuable workshops on topics like personal development and business. This indicates an active community focused on both personal and professional growth.

sections.title: Pricing & Access Guide
sections.body:
Pricing is based on monthly memberships for dedicated spaces, with no mention of casual day passes.

Dedicated Floor Desk: IDR 3,000,000/month.

Dedicated Premium Desk: IDR 4,000,000/month.

Private Office (up to 3-4 people): IDR 11,500,000 - 13,000,000/month.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.body: Nebula is a sanctuary for the modern, wellness-focused entrepreneur. It's the perfect choice for those who believe peak performance is linked to a calm environment and physical well-being. The combination of its serene green aesthetic, deep-focus atmosphere, and unique spa facilities creates a powerful value proposition. It is less suited for casual drop-in users and more for professionals looking to establish a productive and healthy work routine in Bali.

sections.title: Guiding Philosophy
sections.body: PUCO aims to be a "contemporary breakthrough in the #worklifebalance movement" by applying the Balinese philosophy of Tri Hita Karana. This philosophy emphasizes balance and harmony among people (Pawongan), with the environment (Palemahan), and with God (Parhyangan). However, a critical question arises: how is this profound local philosophy actually embodied in PUCO's daily operations? PUCO explicitly claims this philosophy, but its offerings—hourly rates, a restaurant, meeting rooms—seem functionally similar to other coworking spaces. This raises the question of whether the philosophy is a core value deeply integrated into its operations (e.g., through community initiatives, environmental practices, cultural workshops) or if it is used more as a unique branding element. For users seeking an authentic cultural experience, this is a key point to consider.

sections.title: Signature Experience & Unique Features
sections.body:
Rooftop Setting: Its name highlights its key feature. The rooftop location offers excellent rice field views, providing a unique perspective compared to ground-level spaces.

Extreme Pricing Flexibility: PUCO offers one of the most diverse pricing structures, with multiple hourly packages (4, 6, 7 hours), monthly hour bundles (30, 50, 100 hours), and unlimited passes. This caters to a wide range of needs, from the casual user needing a few hours to a full-time member.

Integrated Eatery: The in-house restaurant is a core feature, and members receive a discount.

sections.title: Environment: Layout, Capacity & Vibe
sections.body:
Layout: A spacious main area featuring a large communal table (up to 22 people), standing desks, a 7-person meeting room, a single-person focus room (phone booth), and private offices for 4-8 people. It also has a pet-friendly rooftop terrace.

Capacity: The 22-person communal table, plus private offices and other seating, indicates a medium-sized capacity.

Vibe & Bustle: Reviews suggest the atmosphere is productive and less crowded, especially on Fridays. The view is a major highlight. However, one review noted that phone calls must be taken on the terrace, but the WiFi doesn't work there—a significant flaw.

sections.title: Community: Networking & Events
sections.body: The available information does not contain specifics on public events or workshops hosted by PUCO. Its community aspect seems centered on the "Pawongan" (person-to-person) element of its philosophy, likely fostered via the communal table and eatery, but there is no evidence of a structured event program.

sections.title: Pricing & Access Guide
sections.body:
Highly flexible and granular.

Pay-by-the-Minute: IDR 30,000/hour, capped at IDR 200,000 for the day.

Hourly Passes: 4 hours (IDR 70k), 7 hours (IDR 100k).

Day Pass: IDR 150,000.

Monthly Hour Bundles: 30 hours (IDR 500k), 50 hours (IDR 850k), 100 hours (IDR 1.3M).

Unlimited Monthly Pass: IDR 1.8M (Hot Desk), IDR 2.3M (Dedicated Desk).

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.body: PUCO is the champion of flexibility. Its granular pricing makes it ideal for part-time remote workers, those with unpredictable schedules, or anyone hesitant to commit to a full monthly pass. The rooftop setting is a major bonus. However, the reported issue with terrace WiFi is a serious concern for anyone who needs to make frequent calls. The "Tri Hita Karana" philosophy remains an open question, representing either a deep cultural commitment or a missed opportunity for differentiation.

sections.title: Guiding Philosophy
sections.body: SETTER's philosophy is built around providing a "modern office & coworking concept for productive and focused work." It is a large-scale operation designed to accommodate a diverse community of "creative entrepreneurs, crypto experts, startups, and cultural initiatives."

sections.title: Signature Experience & Unique Features
sections.body:
Sheer Scale: With a 1900 m² building, 38 private offices, and 100 open seats, SETTER is one of the largest and best-equipped spaces in the region. This scale allows it to offer diverse work environments and a massive community.

Ergonomics and Comfort: The space is designed with user comfort in mind, featuring ergonomic designs, excellent lighting, and height-adjustable desks to support standing work.

24/7 Access: All passes, including day passes, grant 24-hour access, which is a significant advantage for those working across different time zones.

sections.title: Environment: Layout, Capacity & Vibe
sections.body:
Layout: A modern, multi-location "powerhouse" (Canggu, Berawa, Ubud) with a "modern industrial aesthetic." The layout includes open-concept areas, private rooms, a rooftop terrace with great views, meeting rooms, and phone booths. They also have a studio for photography and 3D printing.

Capacity: Very high. 100 open seats and 38 private offices that can hold 4-10 people mean it can accommodate hundreds of individuals.

Vibe & Bustle: The atmosphere is described as more "mature and sophisticated." It's a place for focused work, but the large community and regular events also give it a vibrant social dimension. Its quietness rating is moderate (3/5), suggesting a constant hum of activity rather than deep silence.

sections.title: Community: Networking & Events
sections.body: SETTER hosts "regular events for members to connect and integrate into a vibrant community." "Access to the SETTER community" is listed as a benefit for weekly and monthly pass holders. While specific information on public access isn't provided, the focus is clearly on fostering a strong internal network.

sections.title: Pricing & Access Guide
sections.body:
Pricing is in the mid-to-high range, reflecting the quality and scale of the facilities.

Day Pass: IDR 299,000.

Weekly Pass: IDR 890,000.

Monthly Pass (Unlimited): IDR 2,890,000. A slightly different "Unlimited" package is also listed at IDR 3.2M.

Private Office: From IDR 12,890,000/month.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.body: SETTER is the all-rounder "powerhouse." Its large scale, modern facilities, and focus on ergonomic comfort make it a safe and reliable choice for almost any type of professional. It is particularly well-suited for those who value a sophisticated, professional environment and want access to a large and diverse network of professionals. The 24/7 access on all passes is a major competitive advantage.

sections.title: Guiding Philosophy
sections.body: Tropical Nomad aims to help its community "achieve a balanced social and work life." It is positioned as "an authentic escape for entrepreneurs," embodying the classic Canggu digital nomad dream—working in a beautiful tropical setting surrounded by rice fields.

sections.title: Signature Experience & Unique Features
sections.body:
Iconic Design: The space itself is a key feature, with a "tropical setting of indoor and outdoor," a "full white warehouse style with the most beautiful palm tree garden," and a very "photogenic" open-concept design.

Productivity-Focused: Despite the relaxed vibe, reviews consistently praise it as a place to "get work done." It's described as a space that is "both focused and calm."

Lifestyle Amenities: Facilities like a spacious garden, showers, and surfboard racks cater directly to the nomad lifestyle.

sections.title: Environment: Layout, Capacity & Vibe
sections.body:
Layout: An open-concept workspace with plenty of seating, including an air-conditioned room upstairs, standing desks, and a breezy outdoor area. The layout is lauded for being "spacious," "light, airy, and calming."

Capacity: Descriptions of "plenty of seating" and being "spacious" suggest a large capacity that can accommodate many users without feeling crowded.

Vibe & Bustle: The vibe is the quintessential Canggu mix: productive, calm, social, and friendly. Reviews repeatedly mention the "amazing atmosphere," "friendly people," and "very nice staff." You can both focus and easily connect with others in the garden or café. It is highly rated and beloved as a top-tier digital nomad hub.

sections.title: Community: Networking & Events
sections.body: They host events to help members meet new people, with specific examples like "IN.CORP," "TOASTMASTER," and "BAHASA INDONESIA" classes listed on their website. However, one review noted they could improve by "organizing more social events," suggesting the community may be more organic than curated.

sections.title: Pricing & Access Guide
sections.body:
A variety of passes are offered, from short-term to unlimited.

Day Pass: IDR 230,000.

Hourly/Weekly Passes: 7 hours (IDR 180k), Weekly Pass with 8 hours credit (IDR 280k).

Monthly Packages: 50 hours (IDR 1M), 100 hours (IDR 1.7M).

Unlimited Monthly Pass: IDR 2,900,000.

Dedicated Desk: IDR 3,500,000/month.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.body: Tropical Nomad is the archetypal Canggu coworking space. It perfectly captures the aesthetic and vibe that many digital nomads envision when they think of Bali. It's an excellent, reliable choice for new and veteran nomads alike who are seeking a productive, beautiful, and social environment. Its strong reputation and well-balanced offering make it one of the most popular and dependable hubs on the island.

sections.title: Guiding Philosophy
sections.body: Deos is built on the concept of "smart coworking." Its philosophy is to provide a quiet, comfortable, and efficient environment through the seamless integration of technology, delivering "more than just a desk." It is an "autonomous" space.

sections.title: Signature Experience & Unique Features
sections.body:
Tech-Forward Amenities: This is the defining characteristic of Deos. It is equipped with smart lock access, USB-C monitors, built-in Qi wireless chargers, and an automated smart system for lights, AC, and security. This is unique among the spaces listed.

Privacy and Quiet: The space is explicitly designed to be "quiet and comfortable," with a very limited capacity of just 7 people. This is a major selling point and a stark contrast to the large-scale hubs.

Ergonomic Focus: They specifically provide IKEA Markus chairs, which are known for their good ergonomics, showing a commitment to comfort during long work sessions.

sections.title: Environment: Layout, Capacity & Vibe
sections.body:
Layout: A very small, modern, and sleek micro-coworking space. The layout consists of just 4 workstations and 3 bar seats, along with a chill-out area, a restroom with a shower, and an in-house kitchen/café.

Capacity: Extremely low, at a maximum of 7 people. This ensures it is never crowded.

Vibe & Bustle: Due to the low capacity, the atmosphere is guaranteed to be quiet, focused, and productive. It is designed for individuals who need to eliminate distractions. The vibe is more about deep, uninterrupted work than social networking.

sections.title: Community: Networking & Events
sections.body: The available information provides no details on events hosted by Deos. The entire model of Deos runs contrary to large community events. Any "community" would be a very small, tight-knit group of the 7 members working there at the time.

sections.title: Pricing & Access Guide
sections.body:
Pricing is simple and straightforward.

Day Pass: IDR 200,000 (IDR 100,000 for a trial day).

Weekly Pass: IDR 800,000.

Monthly Membership: IDR 2,000,000.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.body: Deos is the ultimate niche space for deep-work professionals. It's perfect for developers, writers, analysts, or anyone easily distracted who needs a quiet, controlled environment. The tech-integrated features are a great convenience, and the low monthly membership price offers exceptional value for those who prioritize focus above all else. It is the antithesis of the large social coworking hubs.
